intro: Amsinckia campestris, commonly known as the field rocket, is a flowering plant in the family Boraginaceae. It is native to the western United States and parts of Mexico, typically found in dry, open habitats. The plant has hairy, branching stems and produces small, blue to purple flowers clustered in racemes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Amsinckia campestris is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is sometimes used in native plant gardens.
